page.title: 12TOAT HILL AND BASHURST COPSE
page.content: The main land use around Toat Farm and Bashurst Copse is farming, especially{rough grazing.}There are also a great many{deciduous trees}and few coniferous trees. At Bashurst Copse, the houses are all made of{local stone}from a quarry near to Christ's Hospital, Horsham. The roofs are either thatched or made of{Horsham slate.} Toat Farm is no longer a farmhouse, the land having been sold or rented out.There are only a few sheep at Toat Farm,and no cattle.The house is Mock _ Tudor, the roof being made of Horsham slate. Lower Toat Farm is a{pork and beef farm. There is a petrol-pump station at Bashurst Copse,but no other amenities. The main crop around this area is {rape,}which is used for oil.
